thread.title: Architectural Digest: Tour the Obamas' Martha's Vineyard Vacation Home
thread.title_full: Architectural Digest: Tour the Obamas' Martha's Vineyard Vacation Home

author: Architectural Digest
title: Architectural Digest: Tour the Obamas' Martha's Vineyard Vacation Home
text:
By Leslie Anne Wiggins for Architectural Digest . 
(photos: courtesy of Wallace & Co.) 
STATS: 6 Bedrooms, 5 Baths, 2 Half-Baths, 6,967 Sq. Ft., $22.5 Million 
The double-height window walls of the sunken living room look out onto the pool area of the vacation home that the First Family rented on Martha's Vineyard. 
An oversize wood-burning fireplace centers the entertaining area at the far end of the airy great room. 
Pale oak covers the floor in the home's main hall. 
The heated infinity pool overlooks the Atlantic. 
See more: Go Inside 8 Amazing Celebrity Homes Up for Sale 
The large kitchen is appointed with a Sub-Zero refrigerator and a Miele dishwasher. 
Wide windows in the master suite allow for views to the pool and the ocean. Next to the bedroom is a private study. 
A guest bedroom has direct access to the property's lush grounds. 
Marble lines the bright master bath. 
The verdant nine-and-a-half-acre property is a private vacationer's dream. 
Contact: Thomas Wallace of Wallace & Co./Sotheby's International Realty, 508-627-3777; wallacemv.com .
